title: Manchester United midfielder Michael Carrick to be asked to take PAY CUT to extend Old Trafford stay
text:
taking the mick Manchester United midfielder Michael Carrick to be asked to take PAY CUT to extend Old Trafford stay 
Club bosses are understood to be offering the influential midfielder an extension, but only if he agrees to reduce his wages to £70,000-a-week Exclusive Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments MICHAEL Carrick is likely to be asked to take a PAY CUT to land another twelve-month deal at Manchester United. 
Old Trafford bosses are understood to be offering him an extension, but only if he agrees to reduce his wages to £70,000-a-week. PA:Press Association Michael Carrick will have to take a pay cut if he wants to stay at Old Trafford for another year Saturday Premier League match preview featuring Chelsea v Arsenal

United made similar moves with Red Devils legends Ryan Giggs, Paul Scholes and Rio Ferdinand when they were in their 30s. 
Carrick is understood to be a big earner at Old Trafford on a wage of around £130,000-a-week. 4 Influential Carrick is understood to be a big earner at Old Trafford on a wage of around £130,000-a-week 
And the England midfielder wants to stay and work with Jose Mourinho, who is a huge admirer of the 35-year-old.

A United source: “Carrick could be asked to take a reduction to his salary to secure another deal. 
“He wants to stay and by all accounts Jose has told the board similar. He is on big wages here and would have to take a cut. Reuters Mourinho will surely want to try and keep the midfielder at all costs Reuters 4 Ryan Giggs and Paul Scholes had the same thing happen to them when they were in their 30s 
“Carrick's influence and experience in United's engine room is undeniable, he’s a key player for the team. 
“But the bean-counters will cite the pay cuts Ryan Giggs and Paul Scholes were prepared to take to remain a part of the story here.” 
Mourinho is in the process of clearing out his squad, after axing flops Memphis Depay and Morgan Schneiderlin for a combined £35m in January. 
He wants to bolster his transfer war-chest to spend around £200m in the summer. 
He will start with a £80m swoop for Atletico Madrid’s 25-year-old striker Antoine Griezmann.
